description.zh-cn: 东汉末年至三国时期曹魏将领，五子良将之一。以坚毅稳重著称，早年战功赫赫，但在樊城之战中因水灾被困而投降关羽，后归魏被曹丕羞辱而病逝。
description.en: A military general serving under the warlord Cao Cao during the late Eastern Han dynasty and the Three Kingdoms period of China. He was one of the Five Elite Generals of Cao Wei. Known for his steadfastness and composure, he had significant military achievements in his early career, but surrendered to Guan Yu during the Battle of Fancheng after being trapped by a flood. He later died of illness and shame after being humiliated by Cao Pi upon his return to Wei.

description.zh-cn: 东汉末期将领，曾招募于禁。
description.en: A general during the late Eastern Han dynasty who recruited Yu Jin.

description.zh-cn: 东汉末年权臣，曹魏的奠基者。于禁长期为其效力。
description.en: A warlord in the late Eastern Han dynasty and the founder of the state of Cao Wei. Yu Jin served him for a long time.

description.zh-cn: 东汉末年至三国时期曹魏的官员，曾是于禁的上司并向曹操推荐了他。
description.en: An official of the late Eastern Han dynasty and Cao Wei during the Three Kingdoms period. He was once Yu Jin's superior and recommended him to Cao Cao.

description.zh-cn: 东汉末期将领，曾是于禁的旧友，后因叛乱被于禁斩杀。
description.en: A general in the late Eastern Han dynasty. He was an old friend of Yu Jin but was executed by him after a rebellion.

description.zh-cn: 东汉末年名将，在樊城之战中击败并俘虏了于禁。
description.en: A famous general in the late Eastern Han dynasty who defeated and captured Yu Jin at the Battle of Fancheng.

description.zh-cn: 三国时期东吴的建立者。于禁在关羽兵败后成为其俘虏，后被其遣返回曹魏。
description.en: The founder of the state of Eastern Wu during the Three Kingdoms period. Yu Jin became his captive after Guan Yu's defeat and was later sent back to Cao Wei by him.

description.zh-cn: 曹魏的开国皇帝。他将于禁从东吴接回，后又用壁画羞辱于禁致其病逝。
description.en: The founding emperor of the state of Cao Wei. He received Yu Jin back from Eastern Wu, but later humiliated him with a mural, leading to his death from illness.

description.zh-cn: 三国时期东吴的官员，在于禁为俘虏期间曾多次呵斥他。
description.en: An official of the state of Eastern Wu during the Three Kingdoms period, who repeatedly berated Yu Jin while he was a captive.

description.zh-cn: 东汉末年至三国时期曹魏的将领，在樊城之战中与于禁一同被击败，但他宁死不降。
description.en: A general of Cao Wei during the late Eastern Han dynasty and Three Kingdoms period. He was defeated alongside Yu Jin at the Battle of Fancheng, but refused to surrender and was executed.

description.zh-cn: 东汉末年至三国时期曹魏的将领，其兵权曾被曹操派于禁夺取。
description.en: A general of Cao Wei during the late Eastern Han dynasty and Three Kingdoms period, whose command was stripped by Yu Jin under Cao Cao's order.

description.zh-cn: 于禁之子，继承了其益寿亭侯的爵位。
description.en: Son of Yu Jin, who inherited his title of Marquis of Yishou Pavilion.

description.zh-cn: 219年发生于荆州北部的一场重要战役，于禁在此战中被关羽击败并俘虏。
description.en: A major battle that took place in northern Jing Province in 219, where Yu Jin was defeated and captured by Guan Yu.

description.zh-cn: 三国时期的北方政权，由曹丕建立。于禁是其重要将领。
description.en: A state in northern China during the Three Kingdoms period, founded by Cao Pi. Yu Jin was one of its prominent generals.

description.zh-cn: 三国时期曹魏势力的五位著名将领的合称，包括张辽、乐进、于禁、张郃、徐晃。
description.en: A collective name for five renowned military generals of Cao Wei during the Three Kingdoms period, including Zhang Liao, Yue Jin, Yu Jin, Zhang He, and Xu Huang.

description.zh-cn: 东汉时期地名，位于今山东泰安南宁阳县，是于禁的籍贯地。
description.en: A location during the Eastern Han dynasty, located in modern-day Ningyang County, south of Tai'an, Shandong. It was Yu Jin's ancestral home.

description.zh-cn: 三国时期的政权之一，由孙权建立。
description.en: One of the three major states that competed for supremacy over China in the Three Kingdoms period, founded by Sun Quan.

description.zh-cn: 三国时期的政权之一，由刘备建立。
description.en: One of the three major states that competed for supremacy over China in the Three Kingdoms period, founded by Liu Bei.

description.zh-cn: 于禁最初响应鲍信的招募而入伍，隶属于其麾下。
description.en: Yu Jin initially joined the army in response to Bao Xin's recruitment and served under his command.

description.zh-cn: 鲍信战死后，于禁及其部下隶属于将军王朗。
description.en: After Bao Xin was killed in battle, Yu Jin and his troops were placed under the command of General Wang Lang.

description.zh-cn: 王朗认为于禁有大将之才，向曹操推荐了他。
description.en: Wang Lang recognized Yu Jin's talent as a great general and recommended him to Cao Cao.

description.zh-cn: 经王朗推荐，于禁开始为曹操效力，成为其麾下重要将领，直至樊城之战被俘。
description.en: Following Wang Lang's recommendation, Yu Jin began to serve Cao Cao and became one of his key generals, until his capture at the Battle of Fancheng.

description.zh-cn: 昌豨与于禁是旧友。
description.en: Chang Xi and Yu Jin were old friends.

description.zh-cn: 昌豨反叛后向于禁投降，但于禁为执行军法，不顾旧交情谊，流泪将昌豨斩杀。
description.en: After rebelling, Chang Xi surrendered to Yu Jin, but to uphold military law, Yu Jin executed him in tears, disregarding their old friendship.

description.zh-cn: 于禁在樊城之战中因汉水暴涨，所率七军被淹没，导致其兵败被俘，这是其人生的重要转折点。
description.en: During the Battle of Fancheng, the seven armies led by Yu Jin were flooded due to the overflowing Han River, leading to his defeat and capture, which became a major turning point in his life.

description.zh-cn: 在樊城之战中，关羽利用大水击败并俘虏了于禁。
description.en: At the Battle of Fancheng, Guan Yu took advantage of the flood to defeat and capture Yu Jin.

description.zh-cn: 在樊城之战中，于禁与庞德同为援军。战败后，于禁投降，而庞德宁死不屈被杀。
description.en: During the Battle of Fancheng, Yu Jin and Pang De were both part of the reinforcement army. After being defeated, Yu Jin surrendered, while Pang De chose death over submission and was executed.

description.zh-cn: 于禁在东吴为俘虏期间，多次受到虞翻的呵斥和羞辱。
description.en: While a captive in Eastern Wu, Yu Jin was repeatedly berated and humiliated by Yu Fan.

description.zh-cn: 于禁归魏后，曹丕命人在曹操陵墓的屋壁上画上关羽战克、庞德愤怒、于禁乞降的壁画来羞辱他，导致于禁羞愤病逝。
description.en: After Yu Jin's return to Wei, Cao Pi ordered a mural to be painted on the wall of Cao Cao's tomb depicting Guan Yu's victory, Pang De's fury, and Yu Jin's surrender, which caused Yu Jin to die from shame and illness.

description.zh-cn: 曹操曾派于禁前往朱灵营中夺其兵权，朱灵及其部下慑于于禁的威严而不敢反抗，此后朱灵成为于禁的部下。
description.en: Cao Cao once dispatched Yu Jin to strip Zhu Ling of his command. Intimidated by Yu Jin's authority, Zhu Ling and his troops did not dare to resist, and Zhu Ling subsequently became Yu Jin's subordinate.

description.zh-cn: 于圭是于禁的儿子。
description.en: Yu Gui was the son of Yu Jin.

description.zh-cn: 于禁是曹魏的“五子良将”之一。
description.en: Yu Jin was one of the "Five Elite Generals" of Cao Wei.

description.zh-cn: 于禁在樊城之战中投降关羽后，作为俘虏被关押于蜀汉（当时为汉中王军队）控制的江陵。
description.en: After surrendering to Guan Yu at the Battle of Fancheng, Yu Jin was held as a prisoner in Jiangling, which was under the control of Shu Han (then the army of the King of Hanzhong).

description.zh-cn: 孙权袭取荆州后，于禁作为俘虏落入东吴手中，直到221年被孙权遣返。
description.en: After Sun Quan seized Jing Province, Yu Jin fell into the hands of Eastern Wu as a captive until he was sent back by Sun Quan in 221.

description.zh-cn: 于禁被孙权遣返后，归属魏文帝曹丕，被任命为安远将军。
description.en: After being sent back by Sun Quan, Yu Jin served under Emperor Wen of Wei, Cao Pi, and was appointed General Who Pacifies the Distant.
